meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be assimilated.
meanings.sent1: The assimilability of the new information made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The assimilability of the language helped the students learn quickly.
meanings.sent3: The assimilability of the puzzle pieces made it a breeze to put together.
meanings.sent4: Her assimilability to different cultures was like a chameleon blending in effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The assimilability of the concept was crystal clear to everyone in the class.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being assimilable.
meanings.sent1: The assimilability of the nutrients in the food ensured good health.
meanings.sent2: The assimilability of the ideas in the discussion led to a productive meeting.
meanings.sent3: The assimilability of the colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent4: His assimilability to change was like a river flowing smoothly around obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The assimilability of the software made it user-friendly for all ages.
